text: Charles Clyde Ebbets was an American photographer who is credited with having taken the iconic photograph Lunch atop a Skyscraper. He was born on August 18, 1905 in Alabama. He got his first camera, a Kodak Brownie when he was 8 years old. The family was struggling so he left school in 10th grade to work for the newspaper in the city. It was then he decided to work toward the idea of making a living from taking pictures. ==References== === Sources === * * Category:1905 births Category:Year of death missing Category:American photographers Category:People from Gadsden, Alabama
title: Charles Ebbets
